授業方法: Classes will consist of lectures and discussion time during which students will share their impressions of assigned readings and deepen their understanding of the associated issues. Short quizzes will be assigned at the beginning of classes to confirm students’ reading comprehension.

第9回: The diversification of Japanese voices (2): Levy Hideo

“Where Europe Begins” and excerpts from “Only There Where You Are There Is Nothing”
第13回: Writing beyond national borders (2): Ito Hiromi
トピック.授業計画1: Each class will consist of an introductory lecture to the writer listed above, followed by a class discussion. When possible, additional activities relating to the translation of literature, such as comparison of multiple translations, will be incorporated into the class.
トピック.授業外学習2: Students will be expected to complete assigned readings and prepare to take part in discussions before each class. Each discussion will be led by a group of students, to be decided at the start of the course. There will be two extended writing assignments, for which students are expected to make use of library and online resources.

教科書/Required texts0: Required readings will be provided to students as digital files.
課題等へのフィードバック方法Methods for Providing Feed: Verbal feedback will be given at the beginning of class relating to students' online assignments. A written comment will be attached to the essay writing assignments to explain the grade.
